title: Fitch Assigns Jiangxi Provincial Water First-Time 'BBB' IDR; Outlook Stable
text:
Fitch Assigns Jiangxi Provincial Water First-Time 'BBB' IDR; Outlook Stable

(The following statement was released by the rating agency) Fitch Ratings-Hong Kong/Shanghai-October 30: Fitch Ratings has assigned China-based Jiangxi Provincial Water Conservancy Investment Group Corp. (JXWC) Long-Term Foreign- and Local-Currency Issuer Default Ratings (IDRs) of 'BBB'. The Outlook is Stable. JXWC is the sole provincial-level water infrastructure and assets investment, development and operation vehicle in the Jiangxi province. It is the investment platform of various key water conservation projects in Jiangxi, and provides water supply for over 40% of the province. Key Rating Drivers 'Very Strong' Status, Ownership and Control: JXWC is a limited liability company under the robust control and supervision of the Jiangxi province. The Jiangxi provincial government owns 100% of its equity shares in JXWC via the provincial Department of Water Resources. The government's approval is required for senior management appointments and major investment and financing activities. JXWC is one of the main government-related entities (GREs) in Jiangxi, focusing on water-related infrastructure construction and asset operation. 'Strong' Support Record and Expectations: Fitch estimates that the water-related business will continue to account for the majority of ZXWC's revenue and transfers and grants from the public sector. JXWC receives support from the Jiangxi province mainly via contracted payments under its infrastructure construction and water supply projects, and transfers and grants from the public sector. Transfers and grants accounted for 17%, on average, of total revenue a year during 2016-2018. The government has issued policies to support JXWC on centralising and managing major reservoirs. 'Moderate' Socio-Political Implications of Default: Fitch believes the government is likely to use administrative and fiscal measures to ensure basic operation of key subsidiaries are not disrupted in the case of a JXWC default. Other GREs or private-sector companies could substitute for JXWC with only minor or temporary disruption to the services. JXWC acts as the provincial investment representative in strategic water-related businesses, including water control infrastructure construction, water supply and reservoir management. The company is the only provincial-level GRE focusing on this business area. 'Moderate' Financial Implications of Default: Fitch believes that a JXWC default from government failure to provide sufficient support would have a moderate impact on the availability and cost of other GREs' domestic and foreign financing options. We estimate JXWC's debts account for a moderate share of Jiangxi's overall risk. JXWC's operating assets and liabilities cover a wide range of water or environmental-related business sectors, including renewable energy and ecological protection projects. 'b' Category Standalone Credit Profile: We assess under Fitch's Public Sector, Revenue-Supported Entities Rating Criteria that JXWC's revenue defensibility is 'Midrange', based on the company's 'Strong' business volume defensibility and 'Weak' bargaining power on prices. We assess JXWC's operating risk as 'Midrange', based on the relatively predictable cost structure. In addition, we assess the financial profile as 'Weaker' due to the company's high capex and leverage. Fitch expects net leverage to remain at above 20x for the next two years, mitigated by a liquidity cushion of 7.7x of operating expenses. Derivation Summary Fitch assessed JXWC under its Government-Related Entities (GRE) Rating Criteria, reflecting Jiangxi province's ultimate ownership and oversight over JXWC, a record of financial support and the company's functional role in Jiangxi's development, a key strategic initiative of the government. These factors indicate a strong incentive by the sponsor to provide extraordinary support to JXWC, if needed. JXWC's IDR was derived from the four factors under our GRE Rating Criteria and the Standalone Credit Profile of 'b' category from our Public Sector, Revenue-Supported Entities Rating Criteria. RATING SENSITIVITIES The ratings on JXWC would be affected by a change in Fitch's perception of the Jiangxi province's ability to provide subsidies, grants or other legitimate resources allowed under China's policies and regulations. An increase in incentive for the Jiangxi province to provide support to JXWC, including stronger socio-political and financial implications of a default by JXWC and a stronger record of support, may trigger positive rating action on JXWC. In contrast, the rating may be downgraded if there is a significant weakening in the socio-political and financial implications of a default by JXWC, a weaker record of support by the province, or a dilution in the government's shareholding. ESG Considerations Unless otherwise disclosed in this section, the highest level of ESG credit relevance is a score of 3 - ESG issues are credit neutral or have only a minimal credit impact on the entity, either due to their nature or the way in which they are being managed by the entity. For more information on Fitch's ESG Relevance Scores, visit www.fitchratings.com/esg.
